Update: I did throw the pizza in the oven the next day to see if I could cook the crust.  Still bad.  I ended up eating just the toppings only off of two slices, then the last two slices went in the garbage.  

Will not order pizza from here again.  Will give other stuff a shot when time comes.

***
The pizza was not delicious because like another Yelper said, the crust is soggy.  It was soggy and didn't taste like it was cooked thoroughly, dough-y like.  

I got a flyer from here so thought would try it as opposed to my usual Nizario's.  

They have a special now for $14 you get a large two topping pie and a 2-litre pop.  With tax and delivery it was $20, so I really didn't save any money.

I would not buy pizza from here again, as I agree the crust tastes uncooked.  I might try other items, but not in any rush.  I will try to throw the leftover slices in the oven to see if it really is a matter of undercooked crust.

2 stars for food.  However, the phone manner was nice, and delivered in less than the 40 minutes they said.  Too bad no half stars.
author: Mrs F.

description:
How can people hate this pizza so much?  Is it the grease?  Does that freak people out?  Come on ... that's where all the flavor is!!

If you're a fan of east coast pizza, you'll be very happy with Marina Pizza.  I feel like I'm back in college again ... :P
author: Jenny K.

description:
Ordered delivery twice. Prices are basically the same as Pronto's.  Marina sorta has better pizza.  The crust is fluffier. But I have a sneaking suspicion they are one in the same because everything from Marina tasted oddly familiar.  Although the menu was different and they offerred more combo choices, the pizza (except the fluffy crust), the shady amount of toppings they give, and the wings had me thinking we caught Pronto on a really good day. 

Its 4 stars for now, but let's see if they keep it up.
author: Dorothy N.

description: Good for a quick and inexpensive bite. My wife enjoyed the marinara sauce. Italian sausage sandwich was quite good also.
author: M H.

description:
This place delivers until 3 in the morning! I wouldn't order anything on their menu, except for pizza. I've gotten good pizza from them on a couple occasions. I've tried to order from them for lunch and gotten some pretty bad sandwiches, but my 2 late night pizzas were pretty tasty. 

So if you're in the mood for some late night pizza goodness, give them a call but in the middle of the day call someone else.
author: Troy R.

description:
Pizza - Zero Stars
Delivery Service - Three Stars

Ordered from here on the recommendation of the Hyatt concierge.  HUGE mistake.   We have never had such tasteless, rubbery-cheese, charred crumbly pepperoni.   The cheese pizza was cardboard with non-descript sauce topped with the awful rubbery cheese that came off in one peeled layer with the first bite.  A total disappointment.
author: Dorothy C.

description:
Oh Marina pizza...You've won again. Why must you be strategically placed on the walk to my friend's house at 2am? I try to resist you with all my might but you are a black hole for my indulgences. Why is your pesto pizza with chicken so alluring? You're like riding a moped: Lot's of fun as long as no one knows you're doing it.

One day I'll have the strength to avoid my walk of shame with you in hand...One day...
author: D R.

description: Not much to say, just a decent food spot when everything else is closed in the Marina. I have a terrible habit of occasional 1am food binges (which should make for some great Elvis style before and after shots once that metabolism gives up on me) , so chicken wings reallyyy hit the spot after a late night out and were delicious (although that may be the opinion of a particularly grumbling stomach)...pizza, however, was just OK...
author: Mahsa K.

description:
Haiku review:

They sent me coupons
I was enticed by pricing
pizza was awful
author: Eric X.

description:
Not the best slice, but it is close to the homeshed so I go there now and again. The cheese slices are good when fresh, but not recommended reheated.  

This one time after bandcamp, I went there and got a slice, it was reheated and came with an extra "new" layer of melted mozzarella to hide its rubbery underside and the edges were charred. I wasn't happy.
author: I. O.

description: I would give this no stars if I could.  Granted, I have not had their pizza, but based on my experience today I would not eat there on principle alone.  I get home and see a menu with some yummy-looking pizza.  I live in the Outer Richmond near Sutro Heights Park.  I check the back of the menu which has a map of the delivery area - yay!  I'm in the designated zone.  I call to order a pizza, tummy rumbling.  The gentleman who took the call automatically said, "that's way too far".  I explained that I was calling because I had received the menu on my door today, and that the map said my area was included.  He asked the driver and called back to tell me that it was indeed too far.  Well, then why the hell did you leave a menu on my door?!  Please revise your delivery map and stop distributing junk mail if you won't honor your advertisements.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
This food is utter crap.  You better be drunk as hell when you eat this...and if you are...just go wait in line at Pizza Orgasmica...the line there isn't worth it, but this isn't worth eating.

Seriously, if you quit dragging your drunk ass here to eat this crap you won't have to run so far the next day and one day someone will open a 'good' pizza place instead...or another f@#%@g korean wine bar :o(

Quit eating here!  Also quit giving this place 3 stars because you feel guilty.  You KNOW this food is craaaaaaaaaaaaaaap!
author: Shawn H.

description:
I like this pizza place. I dont know how others seem to dislike it. Maybe they were going there at the wrong time. I usually order their chicken pesto, meat lovers, four cheese, philly steak sandwich and their strawberry cheesecake (or any other dessert - is also good). My fave is mushroom pizza with cheese. Really taste good. You should also try their Greek/mediterranean salad. Parking is off street, and the price is affordable. 
I would recommend people to eat here.
author: Rokayah S.

description:
Time and time again I am pretty pleased with the pizza from here. Marina Pizza definitely needs to do something about their garlic cheesy bread though. There is DEFINITELY better garlic bread out there.

For someone who has never been a fan of thin crust pizza, this is the only restaurant I'll order it from. The pizza is pretty darn good and is a place I can confidently order from knowing I won't be disappointed.

But people please, fix your garlic bread! Minus one star for the bread.

Give it a try..
author: Alissa K.

description: Nice place.  The pesto and garlic slice was certainly very tasty.  The pizza is doughy and not thin.
author: Jeff J.

description:
The cashier might not be the sharpest tool in the shed, but good lord can this place make a slice.  

Given, it may not include the gourmet toppings of Orgasmica, the amenities of Unos, nor the niceties of Pizza my Heart, but they sure make the pies fresh and hot.

It is fair to say that most times I have eaten here may have been in a drunken stupor where salted cardboard may have suppressed the appetite, but I have ordered from them on sober nights and they are just as good.

I'd recommend the pesto slice, the combo slice, and my personal favorite, the hawaiian with large chunks of pineapple, ham, and rich tangy tomato sauce - the way a hawaiian should be made.

save the high class stuff for the ritz.
author: Isaac L.

description:
SF Food Inspection Score: 88

really not a fan of the pizza though i shouldn't base a review on one slice. but there was barely any cheese, the bread was doughy, and i did not like the veggie assortment. 

though i didn't get completely turned off because the guy working there was so nice and fabulous. 

i'll come back for one more go.
author: Kristina C.

description: terrible pizza, tastes like cardboard and came 1.5 hours after they said it would.
author: Peter G.

description:
We frequently (once or twice a week)  order from this restaurant, but tonight will make me reconsider ever ordering there again.
I ordered a veggie sandwich with no cheese, butter or mayo (vegan, so can't eat it). The sandwich arrived at my house with cheese and mayo. , When I called to rectify and hopefully get a replacement  (this was supposed to be sinner),, the man on the other end argued with me, and tried to tell me what I ordered. I have a receipt that shows EXACTLY what I ordered. He was rude, and apparently isn't going to replace my dinner. Deeply disappointed.
author: crystal e.

description:
THEIR PIZZA?-- not bad after a drunken night.  MARINA CROWD?--- BOOOO!!!  All you see are striped shirt, good looking guys who act like idiots when they're drunk.  You guys wanna know something?! Dressing well DOES NOT make you a gentleman!  You have to act like one too.  So if there are women waiting for their pizzas, maybe you should just sit there quietly and wait for your pizzas as well instead of throwing parmesan cheese at everyone.  IDIOTS!  And how old are you?  And what did your momma teach you?  Sad....you look so hot, but your lack of manners make you such idiots.

Sorry...there's other pizza places in the city with nicer drunk people...with manners too!!
author: Abby E.

description: I ordered a Hawaiian slice on the go the other week and was pleasantly surprised at the quality of pizza here. I'd definitely classify it as thin crust although for those of you that like a thicker crust, it's not as thin as some of the real NY style pizza's.  The crust was crispy and ingredients tasted fresh. My only complaint would be that there was a tad too much cheese on it. I'm seeing some delivery in my near future.
author: Julia N.

description: blah. I am not hard to impress in the pizza category, but this place didnt do it for me. The delivery was very quick, specially for a saturday night so thats a good thing. They have good deals too, we got something like a xlarge, a bunch of wings, and cola for under $20. The pizza, totaly blah. The crust is extra extra thin and not very flavorful. The garlic bread was dry and boring. The wings were ok. Wont be ordering from them again.
author: Audrey V.

description: I'm giving Marina Pizza three stars for now, as my pizza from here was OK but definitely not great.  I should really go ahead and ding the star for spelling Cafe Caffe, and I might just do that if I show up here and find out that it's really not a cafe at all--which I'm 99.77 percent sure it isn't--but do I really want to go to the Marina to do Yelp research?
author: John S.

description: fell in love with their sandwiches. and they are a good size and good price. The staff is very friendly.
author: Courtney H.

description: Yuck.  Eww.  Yuck yuck.  The cheese on the flavorless and meager sauce was that kind that ends up being impossible to chew so you have to swallow a huge bite that you can feel balling-up in your stomach.  Worst pizza I've had in San Fran.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
They are horrible. They don't even deserve any stars at all. Right now 
I have a bag next to me because I have been throwing up ever since I ate their ravioli and lasagna. They fricking gave me food poisoning. And not just me, my boyfriend, and his mom. 

Ughh.. I'm so tired.. it's 1:05 AM , and I can't sleep because my stomach hurts like crazy, because of the stupid poison food they delivered. I'm hecka pissed off..... 

THIS RESTAURANT IS DEFINITELY NOOT RECOMMENDED AT ALL EVER!!
author: Silver T.

description: Meager toppings on a crust so thin that a burnt bottom is inevitable. That it's open late is insufficient reason to give it more stars.
author: Gourmet G.

description: Decent cheap Italian-American food.  Nothing special but you get your money's worth.
author: Mahogany G.

description:
this is where drunk people go when the line at pizza orgasmica is too long.

the cheese is a bit rubbery, the toppings a little sparse. . . but just like chewing spearmint gum whilst drinking jameson. . . i kinda like it.
author: Huey K.

description: So Marina Pizza may not be my favorite pizza, but it's damn good at 1:00 in the morning!  After a night of hitting up most of the bars in my hood, marina pizza always hits the spot. Don't let the long line scare you. The line moves fast and you will feel so much better in the morning if you go to bed with a full stomach!
author: Lisa A.

description: The chicken wings are really good. Juicy, meaty and hot (but not spicy).  Pizza is no good.
author: Wakako U.

description:
i ordered pizza at 3:00 AM on a wed and it was there in 15 min.
these guys are miracle workers
author: Scott K.

description: One of the worst I've had to date.  Still bad even if you've had a couple of drinks.  Do yourself a favor and "walk on by"
author: Tom C.

description: Good mom and pop place on Lombard St. I had a slice of Hawiiaan pizza, and it was overflowing with pineapple and ham (YUM!). They have a pretty good selection of pastas, lasagnas and different pizzas. The full pizzas weren't as cheap as I hoped, but still relatively reasonable.
author: Chynna Y.

description: Ordered from them again. Again, the ravioli was bomb and the chicken wings were soooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo good.
author: Nicole L.

description: My purse was stolen off the back of my chair here and the staff didnt care. I hate this place!!!
author: Dee C.

description: Decent pizza considering we ordered it at like midnight on a Thursday night.  We ordered the Hawaiian pizza (med) with Caesar salad and sodas.  The pizza looked decent.  Skimpy with the cheese and the cheese was rubbery and slid off when you took a bite or pulled apart the pieces.  The pizza was a bit SOGGY in the middle and very limp.   No texture to the crust.  The meat & pineapple toppings were generous and the pizza delivery time was super fast.  The salad was fresh and good though.  I really think this place needs to par bake the pizza dough before adding the toppings to give the pizza crust more stability and less leakage.  I am a baker so take it from me.  Anyways if its late and your hungry I guess give it a chance otherwise if its early in the night I would move on and try someplace else.
author: angella c.

description: one day on my way from one job to my other job I was looking for some quick lunch and hoping to find a good slice of pizza.  This place looked pretty quick, convenient, and not too bad.  I went in and they had a lunch special...2 slices of pizza and a soda for I think $6 (can't remember for sure this was a few months ago) so I ordered it.  It was ready in about 10 minutes so I was pleased with that and the employees had pretty good service however the pizza....did not taste that great.  It wasnt absolutely horrible but I probably wouldn't come back here.
author: Shea M.

description: This place is amazing!  It was so good and was not expensive. Their thin crust is freakin' amazing.  I love their cheese and they have every topping you could want.  Seriously.  I felt at home.  The owner took our order and made sure we were taken care of.  I will look for this place again.
author: Rick G.

description: Great slices! Super friendly staff. LIke $5 for a couple of slices and a coke for lunch. Stark contrast to other Marina eats despite the name. Was a random pigeon cruising around inside... so only 3 stars for letting a pigeon in... :)
author: Robert A.

description: Not the best pizza in town, but the best for large orders.  You can feed 10 people for 6 bucks a pop, including delivery.  I also like their large salad.
author: Andrew C.

description: I recently ate here after going to the Lumiere because my friend said she really liked the pizza. Well, I was very disappointed. The friend I went with got a slice with a little undercooked mozzarella on top -maybe a redone old slice, perhaps? Mine was just normal, thin crust, barely any cheese, very small slice. Crisp, but in that old piece of toast way. The salad was awful too. When you get a Greek salad and they say "what kind of dressing would you like?" you know you're in trouble.
author: Liss C.

description: So you went out boozin in the marina on a weeknight and now you need to get your late night pizza fill.  The only problem is that it is after midnight and since it isn't thu-sat pizza o is closed....  Pizza Pino is your place.  It is no substitute, but in a pinch they have a satisfying slice.  The staff there is used to putting up with the drunks (they are less than a block from about 5 bars) so fear not, you will not go hungry.
author: Robert R.

description: What's a girl to do when she's jonesing post-drinking grub after last call in the Marina and doesn't want to cab it all the way to Grubstake? Mel's on Lombard, my friends, closes before 2 am on weeknights. But lovely Pizza Pino just a few doors down from Mel's is open past 2 am and serves pizza by the slice.
author: shoba d.

description: Rubbery cheese, tasteless crust, even more tasteless toppings (what was supposed to be pepperoni and tomato), and somehow it ended up being one of the most salty pieces of food I've ever tried to eat.  The delivery was on time, but I took two bites and threw it into the compost.  Unfortunately, a complete waste of money, time, and appetite.
author: Chip B.

description: For a city with pretty poor pizza, this is pretty good.  Try the Pino special.  Calzone is also a winner.  Free delivery.  Great (relative) prices and there's always a coupon.
author: Cully W.

description: Indeed I ate here.  I ate here and it was ok.  Parking was found directly outside.  Indeed it was.  The cashier threw water cups at us, but maybe that was just an accidental wrist flick.  Is there a party happening somewhere yet? I'm bored.
author: Dana M.

description:
I've been going here for years, we have now rediscovered Marina Pizza. 
 
To judge any pizza you must order the "cheese" pizza and eat it immediately.  Marina Pizza passes this test with a "A" rating.  

Their cheese pizza has the melt-in-your-mouth crust with a buttery cheese flavor that let's you know That's amore"!!  After this test, you can order any of their delicious combinations with confidence.  Try their new burgers, too!!!  Try to find that at other pizza delivery places.
author: Harlow P.

description: A great alternative to Pizza Orgasmica!  Is Orgasmica really worth the 45 minute wait to get a single f'ing slice of pizza??  Granted, it's pretty decent pizza, but let's face it, I could be selling dog doo on a stick, but if you put me right in the Fillmore/Greenwich corridor with Balboa Cafe, Matrix, City Tavern, and Eastside West...at 2am, everyone is going to be in line to get a bite of dog doo.   Skip the wait, go 2 blocks down to Marina Pizza for a semi-decent slice of pizza.
author: Andrew C.

description: Great pizza.  Much better than chain stores!!!  You can always order by the slice or by the pie.  They are even open late, like till 3 AM.
author: Aaron C.

description: Had three large pizzas delivered for a birthday party.  The Combo was a little pricey, but tasted great.  The Cheese and Pepperoni were alright - good value for the price - not great tasting, but not bad either.   Delivery was on time.
author: Boomer D.

description:
Not much to say beside it's a decent slice (thin) late at night

I do have to point out that you get the Frankenstein slice here where you can clearly see the base (old) vs the toppings just sprinkled on (solid: combo, greco) which is a big turn off.. oh well this is the only game in town (in the area) when Orgasmica is closed

Bonus: plenty of space so you can sprawl over a table in your your drunkeness
author: xo x.

description: We live in the Richmond and have been ordering pizza from them in a year, and we love it. They offer great deals (Marina Deal x-large 2 topping pizza/2liter soda) for under 20 bucks. Pizza is tasty, but I have to say the best thing about them is their prompt delivery and the fact that they deliver until 3am. They are so fast, and always arrive earlier than stated time!
author: Camille B.

description: This is the only place I know of that really comes close to an east coast pizzeria.  The pizza here is great.  Nothing fancy, just basic, tasty, this pizza.  I often get the chicken parm sandwich, but it's only average.  The ham and cheese is rather tasty, but not nearly as substantial.  The wings taste fantastic.  Sometimes they come overcooked, but such is life.  This place is open late so you can hit up the late night eats after the bars close.
author: Nate B.

description: The pizza is good, not going to lie. And it is open late. The prices are reasonable. The big, big, big negative which is the only reason I would stay away is the service and the owner/cashier. The cooks are quick, but this one guy is rude, nickle-and-dimes his customers, and is not respectful. You want a to-go box or a glass of water from their sink? Good luck. You have to convince him for that, because he says that he does not want to give it to you. Truly a disgusting way to treat your customers. It is sad.
author: Andrew K.

description:
average pizza

but my friend from NJ swears it's the most authentic she's ever had...
author: Joy Y.

description: I love this place! ive been there a few times already, the hawaiian pizza and cheese pizza are awesome! people are friendly and its cozzy, nice place to sit down, have something yummy!, and hang out with friends..great prices..im coming back
author: Maria E.

description: As far as late night delivery goes, i'd recommend this marina pizza & cafe over any other place.  They have THE best chicken wings you can get at 3am. The ravioli is great, chicken parm sandwich is solid.  Pizza is ok but I'm a new york pizza snob so nothing really gets me excited outside of arinelle's.  Food arrives hot and close to the time they quote.
author: michael r.

description:
solid 3
i got pizza at 5pm on weeknight
was getting an estimate across the street at peters auto radio for good-ole-boy CB install in an audi
there was an old lady in the store asking them (radio installers) a million questions for a frikin $200 system
I could tell she wasnt going anytime soon
I remembered in one of my drunken nights there was a cool pizza store close bye ( pizza orgasmica ) + plus I was hungry and didnt want to wait for the simpsons-lady-with-cats to stop asking questions
I decided to play frogger and attempt to cross Lombard during rush hour
Made it across and walked 2 more blocks but PO was closed so I walked back and lowered my standards
Rounded the KFC and had two street people laying on the ground ask me for food, i didnt give in
Went into MP
I wanted to actually see the pizza before ordering a slice or two, but they didnt have any
4 minutes he said
well i could see across the street that the lady had left the shop
so i had to make a decision
i chose pizza, sight unseen
i got it not too hot and a snapple
pizza was eh... snapple was warm, i got fed
aggro level down a small percentage
I jaywalked thru the middle of Lobmard's barrier bushes cuz I didnt want to prance past the laying-in-the-gutter couple on the way back to the closest corner whilst enjoying pizza
they place seems like it caters more to all the drunk marina douchebags late at night
I think PO up the street even has a bouncer in the drunk hours
author: G K.

description: I had written and rates this place with one star because if the cutomer service and food. But the owner contacted me and apologized and it made me want to change my review.  He was very friendly and offered me a the credit they owed me! This place is now highly recommned!
author: Veronica C.

description: If you ever crave organic lental soup, this is the place to go. It's a wonderful alternative if you don't feel like eating fast food after the bars close.
author: Marina Y.

description: Ya know I really like the pizza this place has but for a while I wasnt ordering due to two upsetting expeiences. I ordered once and the guy on the phone messed up the order even after I had him repeat the order back to me. I got a broccoli and green olive pizza delivered to me instead of a ricotta and green olive that I had orderd and I have to say that was a NASTY mix of toppings. The second time I called I made sure he had it right but after an HOUR AND A HALF of waiting for the delivery I finally called only to find out that they had attempted to deliver but called the wrong phone number when they got to my house. I even used the correct number so they could access my account for the order. When I called about this they didnt apologize and said they would redeliver and they brought me a wilted salad and cold pizza. They should have atleast given me a fresh salad for their mistake. However,  its truly tasty pizza and affordable with late night delivery so after a 2 month boycott I gave it another chance and have been happy ever since making sure I speak clearly and loudly and check that they have the correct #. I DO RECCOMMEND this place sometimes you have to forgive and forget.
author: M K.

description: What a pleasant surprise.  I hadn't been here in years and it was pretty good tonight.  Thin crust medium veggie pizza and two sodas for $21.  We ordered around 8:30p and it only took about 15 minutes.  Lots of veggies, light cheese, light on the tomato sauce.  If you are starving, get the large.
author: Brian L.

description: This pizza always seems to hit the spot for me. Be it 2 in the morning after a drunken night out......or even at a reasonable dinner time. Prices are pretty inexpensive but delivery sometimes takes a while. I wouldn't know how to comment about the next day leftovers - because it usually all gets gobbled up right away.
author: Aline W.

description: A great local place to pick up a plain slice on the run. Fast, cheap, and yummy.  They have a wide variety of other food on their menu -- it's all decent, but the slices are where it's at!
author: Cheeky C.

description: This pizza is my favorite!  In addition to great pizza, I called for delivery for the first time tonight and it was the most pleasant delivery ordering experience ever!  What a fantastic place - you guys are awesome!
author: Joanna C.

description: mmmmmmmm.  pizza.  mmmmmmmmmmm.  really crispy (or should i say well done) crusts and cheese that sort of melts in your mouth.  ok, who am i kidding, it's totally open late, which is why i love it!
author: Anjali K.
